text: okay guys show us what you got
it's late spring and so naturally our
thoughts turned to hockey the Stanley
Cup Finals are gonna be played one of
these months and it seems like a very
good time to revisit slap shot George
Roy hill in 1977 film starring Paul
Newman sorry when is the triumph fryer
you can't eat those guys you know the
folks here are criminals most folk hero
started out as it's one of the crudest
most profane most cynical sports movies
ever made and you might think of slap
shot as the evil twin of Hoosiers or of
any other inspirational uplifting sports
flick about a group of underdog misfits
led by a crusty old coach there's
certainly none crustier than Paul
Newman's Reggie Dunlop Reggie coaches
and plays for the Charlestown Chiefs a
minor league hockey team in western
Pennsylvania they might go out of
business because the local mills have
all shut down and Reggie comes up with
an ingenious and simple plan to win
games and boost attendance his guys are
gonna go out on the ice and start
fighting
like most other sports movies slapshot
celebrates the drive to win but in this
case it's about winning dirty winning
cheap winning by forfeit the climactic
moment of triumph which every sports
movie has to have doesn't involve rising
to the occasion or fulfilling your
destiny but being dragged back down into
the mud with everybody else we like to
tell ourselves that athletic competition
is about the noble pursuit of excellence
